properties.description: The unique ID for the list.

properties.description: If skip_merge_validation is true, member data will be accepted without merge field values, even if the merge field is usually required. This defaults to false.
properties.label: Skip Merge Validation

properties.description: Email address for a subscriber.
properties.label: Email Address
properties.name: email_address

properties.description: Subscriber's current status.

properties.description: Type of email this member asked to get ('html' or 'text').
properties.label: Email Type
properties.name: email_type

properties.description: A dictionary of merge fields where the keys are the merge tags.
properties.label: Merge Fields
properties.name: merge_fields

properties.description: The key of this object's properties is the ID of the interest in question.
properties.label: Interests

properties.description: If set/detected, the subscriber's language.

properties.name: language

properties.description: VIP status for subscriber.

properties.label: Enabled

properties.description: IP address the subscriber signed up from.
properties.label: Ip Signup

properties.description: The date and time the subscriber signed up for the list in ISO 8601 format.

actions.title: Add a new member to the list

properties.description: The MD5 hash of the lowercase version of the list member's email address.
properties.name: id

properties.description: Email address for a subscriber.
properties.name: email_address

properties.description: An identifier for the address across all of Mailchimp.
properties.name: unique_email_id

properties.description: As Mailchimp evolves beyond email, you may eventually have contacts without email addresses. While the id is the MD5 hash of their email address, this contact_id is agnostic of contact’s inclusion of an email address.
properties.name: contact_id

properties.description: The contact's full name.
properties.name: full_name

properties.description: The ID used in the Mailchimp web application. View this member in your Mailchimp account at https://{dc}.admin.mailchimp.com/lists/members/view?id={web_id}.
properties.name: web_id

properties.description: Type of email this member asked to get ('html' or 'text').
properties.name: email_type

properties.description: Subscriber's current status.
properties.name: status

properties.description: A subscriber's reason for unsubscribing.
properties.name: unsubscribe_reason

properties.description: Indicates whether a contact consents to 1:1 messaging.
properties.name: consents_to_one_to_one_messaging

properties.description: A dictionary of merge fields where the keys are the merge tags. See the Merge Fields documentation for more about the structure.
properties.name: merge_fields

properties.description: The key of this object's properties is the ID of the interest in question.
properties.name: interests

properties.description: Open and click rates for this subscriber.
properties.name: stats

properties.description: A subscriber's average open rate.
properties.name: avg_open_rate

properties.description: A subscriber's average clickthrough rate.
properties.name: avg_click_rate

properties.description: Ecommerce stats for the list member if the list is attached to a store.
properties.name: ecommerce_data

properties.description: The total revenue the list member has brought in.
properties.name: total_revenue

properties.description: The total number of orders placed by the list member.
properties.name: number_of_orders

properties.description: The three-letter ISO 4217 code for the currency that the store accepts.
properties.name: currency_code

properties.description: IP address the subscriber signed up from.
properties.name: ip_signup

properties.description: The date and time the subscriber signed up for the list in ISO 8601 format.
properties.name: timestamp_signup

properties.description: The IP address the subscriber used to confirm their opt-in status.
properties.name: ip_opt

properties.description: The date and time the subscriber confirmed their opt-in status in ISO 8601 format.
properties.name: timestamp_opt

properties.description: Star rating for this member, between 1 and 5.
properties.name: member_rating

properties.description: The date and time the member's info was last changed in ISO 8601 format.
properties.name: last_changed

properties.description: If set/detected, the subscriber's language.
properties.name: language

properties.description: VIP status for subscriber.
properties.name: vip

properties.description: The list member's email client.
properties.name: email_client

properties.description: Subscriber location information.
properties.name: location

properties.description: The location latitude.
properties.name: latitude

properties.description: The location longitude.
properties.name: longitude

properties.description: The time difference in hours from GMT.
properties.name: gmtoff

properties.description: The offset for timezones where daylight saving time is observed.
properties.name: dstoff

properties.description: The unique code for the location country.
properties.name: country_code

properties.description: The timezone for the location.
properties.name: timezone

properties.description: The region for the location.
properties.name: region

properties.description: The marketing permissions for the subscriber.
properties.name: marketing_permissions

items.description: The marketing permissions for the subscriber.

properties.description: The id for the marketing permission on the list
properties.name: marketing_permission_id

properties.description: The text of the marketing permission.
properties.name: text

properties.description: If the subscriber has opted-in to the marketing permission.
properties.name: enabled

properties.description: The most recent Note added about this member.
properties.name: last_note

properties.description: The note id.
properties.name: note_id

properties.description: The date and time the note was created in ISO 8601 format.
properties.name: created_at

properties.description: The author of the note.
properties.name: created_by

properties.description: The content of the note.
properties.name: note

properties.description: The source from which the subscriber was added to this list.
properties.name: source

properties.description: The number of tags applied to this member.
properties.name: tags_count

properties.description: Returns up to 50 tags applied to this member.
properties.name: tags

properties.description: The tag id.
properties.name: id

properties.description: The name of the tag.
properties.name: name

properties.description: The list id.
properties.name: list_id

properties.description: A list of link types and descriptions for the API schema documents.
properties.name: _links

items.description: A list of link types and descriptions for the API schema documents.

properties.description: As with an HTML 'rel' attribute, this describes the type of link.
properties.name: rel

properties.description: This property contains a fully-qualified URL that can be called to retrieve the linked resource or perform the linked action.
properties.name: href

properties.description: The HTTP method that should be used when accessing the URL defined in 'href'. Possible values: "GET", "POST", "PUT", "PATCH", "DELETE", "OPTIONS", or "HEAD".
properties.name: method

properties.description: For GETs, this is a URL representing the schema that the response should conform to.
properties.name: targetSchema

properties.description: For HTTP methods that can receive bodies (POST and PUT), this is a URL representing the schema that the body should conform to.
properties.name: schema

triggers.description: Triggers when an Audience subscriber is added to the list.
triggers.name: subscribe

properties.description: The list id of intended audience to which you would like to add the contact.
properties.label: List Id
properties.name: listId

triggers.title: Subscribe
